content.title: SMA Embolism
content.definition: Cardiac source (AF, MI). Classic triad: severe pain, minimal findings, AF. Typically lodges at SMA take-off.
content.statement: SMA Embolism is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Mesenteric-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding SMA Embolism helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of SMA Embolism include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of SMA Embolism.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
